t: Isaiah 26
Song of Trust in God’s Protection
In*p that day this song will be sung in the land of Judah: “We*pn have a strong city; He*ln sets up walls and ramparts for security.
Open*ln the gates, that the righteous nation may enter, The*ln one that remains faithful.
The*ln steadfast of mind You will keep in perfect peace, Because*ln he trusts in You.
Trust*ln in the Lord*s forever, For*ln in God*s the Lord,*s we*i have*i an everlasting Rock.
For*ln He has brought low those who dwell on high, the unassailable city; He*ln lays it low, He lays it low to the ground, He casts it to the dust.
The*ln foot will trample it, The*ln feet of the afflicted, the steps of the helpless.”
The*ln way of the righteous is smooth; O*ln Upright One, make the path of the righteous level.
Indeed,*ln while*i following*i the way of Your judgments, O Lord,*s We*ln have waited for You eagerly; Your*ln name, even Your memory, is the desire of our*i souls.
At*ln night my soul longs for You, Indeed,*ln my spirit within me seeks You diligently; For*ln when the earth experiences Your judgments The*ln inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.
Though*iln the wicked is shown favor, He*ln does not learn righteousness; He*ln deals unjustly in the land of uprightness, And*ln does not perceive the majesty of the Lord.*s
O*ln Lord,*s Your hand is lifted up yet*i they do not see it. They*ln see Your*i zeal for the people and are put to shame; Indeed,*ln fire will devour Your enemies.
Lord,*sln You will establish peace for us, Since*ln You have also performed for us all our works.
O*ln Lord*s our God, other masters besides You have ruled us; But*iln through You alone we confess Your name.
The*ln dead will not live, the departed spirits will not rise; Therefore*ln You have punished and destroyed them, And*ln You have wiped out all remembrance of them.
You*ln have increased the nation, O Lord,*s You*ln have increased the nation, You are glorified; You*ln have extended all the borders of the land.
O*ln Lord,*s they sought You in distress; They*ln could only whisper a prayer, Your*ln chastening was upon them.
As*ln the pregnant woman approaches the*i time*i to give birth, She*ln writhes and*i cries out in her labor pains, Thus*ln were we before You, O Lord.*s
We*ln were pregnant, we writhed in*i labor,*i We*ln gave birth, as it seems, only*i to wind. We*ln could not accomplish deliverance for the earth, Nor*ln were inhabitants of the world born.

Your*ln dead will live; Their*ln corpses will rise. You*ln who lie in the dust, awake and shout for joy, For*ln your dew is*i as*i the dew of the dawn, And*ln the earth will give birth to the departed spirits.
Come,*ln my people, enter into your rooms And*ln close your doors behind you; Hide*ln for a little while Until*ln indignation runs its*i course.

For*ln behold, the Lord*s is about to come out from His place To*ln punish the inhabitants of the earth for their iniquity; And*ln the earth will reveal her bloodshed And*ln will no longer cover her slain.
